definitions.definition: The amount of money or resources earmarked for a particular institution, activity or time-frame.
An itemized summary of intended expenditure; usually coupled with expected revenue.
A socket in which the end of a cavalry carbine rests.
To construct or draw up a budget.
definitions.example: Budgeting is even harder in times of recession

definitions.definition: To provide funds, allow for in a budget.
definitions.example: The PM’s pet projects are budgeted rather generously

definitions.definition: To plan for the use of in a budget.
definitions.example: The prestigious building project is budgeted in great detail, from warf facilities to the protocollary opening.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to a budget.

definitions.example: We flew on a budget airline.
